item.title: Report E-2024080695
item.description:
Report E-2024080695

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 16, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of hydrochloric acid was punctured by a skid and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the hydrochloric acid-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081650
item.description:
Report X-2024081650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-10
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE DUE TO IT LEAKING AN UNKNOWN GREY COLORED PAINT MATERIAL. UNABLE TO DETERMINE ANY INFORMATION ON THE PAINT PAILS DUE TO THE SEVERITY OF THE LEAK. THERE WAS AN ADDITIONAL UN1950 AEROSOL, FLAMMABLE X 12 OZ CAN OF REDISPRAY INHIBITIVE SHOPCOAT DARK GREY PRIMER THAT DID NOT LEAK. INVOICE AND THERMAL LABEL DESCRIPTION INDICATES PAINT BUT DOES NOT HAVE ANY DANGEROUS GOODS PAPERWORK OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO DECLARE THE PAINT PRODUCT OR THE UN1950 AEROSOL. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
